title: Grade 12 - Drafting and Computer - Aided Design 30 (2020)
subject: Practical and Applied Arts

document.title: Grade 12 - Drafting and Computer - Aided Design 30 (2020)

378CA0AF4B24457E9EB83B17ED3DA5CB.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

6558302FA43C4BEF921996B14335E8E1.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

4AA71ECDD73A4E6B8E7E24251E522F37.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement

FB99490F150A43BC8C30E848BAB82A85.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

9833DECDE4E445B29E10C6569E03205F.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, • opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

8F1E282E0D2047599D2A42CD3BEE518C.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

1D1B45ABCC4C4CCC90452ECE7E55A226.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

ACF879C555FC438AAF54D6014836F014.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

73C67412B22F48479B4EF762767C0B06.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

3DB9F4CB52A641DB97243367FAC129CB.description: Participate in a work placement experience

553E2C5BFC02480B8621A1D342F95755.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview

0D778A592C2A4178BBBC81C837C34204.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

EE10F61DE2C84FCE9C4565F1DA17AFAE.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

AE458CC5A0E548119C98CC9451862775.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

757E7AA4D47D4A50A76FE92E742B9AF5.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

B15CE0CDFECC46479CECB41EADDE7E3A.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

6FFB7677A9604B2CA9E771311A9B3DA2.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

740E93C5B74B4E40AE7E88FBB3B5CC50.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

50AFCC2F531E4A98AB96415332453A90.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

309DC4516B7F44FC8806439CDA63004E.description: Develop a plan to attain a job of personal interest in the drafting field.

31541D8BDE244225B65125752EE346B4.description: Analyze personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific drafting related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; professional and/or licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the occupation.

03D880691B0B43A58BFE080BA5DCA041.description: Interview or connect with others to discuss drafting related occupations.

F166AFA56F8A4C118888B1359B36C08E.description: Identify which drafting and computer-aided design related occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally and/or nationally.

4F743C0F5B364A4B929DD6786CDCB4E4.description: Explore gender diversity in careers related to mechanical drafting in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

C686B4C494C44BE0880BAB7011CAF1B8.description: Discuss the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in mechanical drafting related careers.

4D1E4A4D363B4D108F76C9C7C2D3A514.description: Analyze mechanical drafting related occupations in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

6EA0A9BA4C204C2D82355AE2FD8288C1.description: Reflect on and share with peers the successes and challenges experienced during the project development.

17A5E5F1A0D245DC99E6F22178F0AC46.description: Identify options (e.g., using LISP programming, Python programming to automate repetitive tasks) for streamlining workflow for the next project.

1479524FAE644617BE6BBC40F0DA2FE9.description: Present and share the results of project.

1A07807C8A1B4FF68C966E38111B36D1.description: Develop an assessment of personal skills, attitudes, work habits, and the final product.

2A1BD91FC80D4FC2A8614CBB7A186986.description: Construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self or peer evaluation form) to assess the process and product

5FBDCC11BCAB42FE966D3B94567A7249.description: Create professional drawings in consideration of all industry standards.

4BA0C787934B4DFEAB9F9DB31E9160AB.description: Produce a set of working drawings with all required views, dimensions, details, notes and schedules.

7A720A6B28114B4E965F4DCD05305D84.description: Select the software program required for the project.

3775DABBFB7A4317AEB97D9949AFE79F.description: Conduct an inquiry of required tools, skills and timelines associated with a selected project.

854E0DE856244069A432E025A31362EE.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency of mechanical drafting skills to complete a project.

B0D63FA1BC1E44038F0A84FFF3E6DC6A.description: Identify common fasteners (e.g., counterbore, countersunk, hex head).

1C5AAD69BDA84BCAB01050874AC34075.description: Distinguish among wood joints (e.g., butt, mitre, dado, mortise and tenon, dowel, biscuit) and their applications.

94FD4CDBD4984F409C4460E64D4F8F3F.description: Identify and place basic welding symbols and associated joints on a drawing.

786EA11FD00E4289B6A191BA1C68B8C4.description: Determine thread designations and state the components of the designation.

5549B741CD4D4E228B82765E4B10BA5B.description: Investigate different thread forms (e.g., unified, metric, square, acme) and their applications

558838D766C941878E1AB0F3677F9A0E.description: Categorize fasteners by type: head shape and drive type; grade; diameter and length; pitch; and, series

E4CADBA658334D06A7A313813767AC72.description: Investigate the purpose and use of fasteners and joints

DFA508D5521E47BD8BB4A280FA9189F5.description: Represent appropriate fasteners and/or fastening methods for given context.

6B5E88C94CE94A84938F91FC0154940B.description: Predict future possibilities and implications of fabrication technology.

0E81817540C444F581AAEAEC0694B4B9.description: Discuss copyright and patent implications of designs.

F9536E6A29714BF4A13C5C0E3D927892.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of the computer fabrication of products in the context of ethical implications, cost production (single vs mass), and environmental issues.

658B3BA5EBE04E6DBC43BDB1808F580A.description: Calculate costs associated with producing a designed and fabricated product. Breakdown material list. Efficiency of material (e.g., tensile strength, hardness, pliability, ductility).

BAA505728FDF49CCA9A00B9DBE3EC0C2.description: Investigate alternatives to materials used in fabricated products

3730675C721A41BFA023A59994589D12.description: Create 3D objects using available equipment (e.g., 3D printer, CNC mill, lathe).

4963C9E4704B474494D0BD5BEE7C8FB9.description: Develop prototypes to address specific needs based on selected criteria (e.g., use, quantity, cost) following a standard design process, including: identifying the problem; identifying known variables; identify the solution by producing sketch, 2D drawing, model and prototype; testing and validating the prototype; and, reflecting and making necessary changes.

B734025B9FEF4293A44AD1B2504AB06D.description: Create models of objects in a 3D environment.

2D0832CD4BC042E381981D66C489B45D.description: Explore significance of CAD in the operation of manufacturing equipment (e.g., 3D printer, CNC mill, lathe).

B7C93F0C34C04FFEA4B54C205D0D3C4D.description: Investigate commercial and industrial applications of CAD.

4910F9D3D7084FE3A2D26CE03589ACD3.description: Manipulate an existing model in a three dimensional (3D) environment.

3A92094F8DD3492D9F9273626223C557.description: Design, model and fabricate a product.

04E7071A8BB74514B2FF68A6A821E578.description: Discuss different industries that use pattern developments.

7BAD6B47125840CF8D9921DB80FB8550.description: Produce pattern developments for: basic rectangular prisms; truncated rectangular prisms; truncated cylinders; cones; pyramids; rectangular to round transition pieces; and, oblique pyramids.

BB2848C48A8E44078661EFC4A6342FA5.description: Draw or plot patterns on cardboard in order to construct pattern developments.

3396D14E61774506B8595BF3295B10B2.description: Research Saskatchewan based industries that incorporate piping drawings.

1D5EC4BAEC91464A94CB17BF96B0D78C.description: Produce piping drawings to scale: • Draw single line multi-view piping drawings and create blocks. Draw single line isometric piping drawings. Dimension piping drawings. Use appropriate technical terms in drawings.

42817759BFA74E499A3565EAA3698828.description: Research the purpose and functions of different materials (e.g., joint valves, fittings) used in piping.

A9F4695BEC07447BB91B7B549733D520.description: Investigate different examples of pipe and their uses.

82C052EFE7974B09B940AF28A548D4E0.description: Represent 3D objects presented on a two-dimensional plane in relation to sizes and shapes on multi-view drawings.

62907F2168B04A8CAFFA6801060BC2E2.description: Produce simple hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical schematics.

58D6A282116D49468B44E3B7826D15CD.description: Interpret hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical schematics.

034E6B66BBD4414FBDCD90EBD8F9D9E6.description: Identify the standard symbols used in hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical schematics.

7782158D454045CBB349BF445E80B445.description: Discuss the purpose of technical terms associated with hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical schematics (e.g., valves, pumps, motors, air supply, resistors, switches, solenoid).

2A7D3B6493654CA5B703C05021681501.description: Create hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical schematic drawings.

75B9AD87712A400FAB23660D7399DAAF.description: Draw object surfaces located off (auxiliary view) planes.

1C55C9698EBE48ED95917642A19E6516.description: Produce drawings with primary and secondary auxiliary views, that include. • identifying auxiliary and non-auxiliary surfaces; • rotating an object to view auxiliary surfaces; • locating inclined edges of surfaces; and, • accurately drawing inclined surfaces.

9932DDA312644A35A26DDEA999F9B9FA.description: Discuss shape description in multi-view drawings.

9A3D29A3450042668D510FEACFADF7EF.description: Produce simple working drawings for mechanical projects that include: drawing and dimensioning each part; laying out the parts effectively in a title block; drawing an assembly drawing that shows all the parts; labelling parts and including general notes, when necessary; and, creating a parts list or a bill of material.

C6D75C46A3754FEDBD9CD1076C1504E1.description: Determine the types of views (e.g., section view, detail view, auxiliary view) and the number of views required to describe each part of a specific mechanical object accurately, paying attention to the assembly order and function of parts.

F02ACC15C8A44BE19505AE4D9FF2E9A7.description: Determine the optimal number of views required to represent each part of a specific mechanical object.

C88640FDE35141A0B2E2B585A52EEA23.description: Research and describe characteristics of various types of drawings (e.g., manufacturing drawings, assembly drawings, general arrangement drawings, working drawings, part drawings, weldment drawings, forming drawings, profile drawings, burning drawings)

92D836C9A5204192997633A56242801B.description: Demonstrate and apply knowledge of terminology used in mechanical drafting industry.

9AAD771CAC6E4D7C964E8B2AC05B8B71.description: Produce detail of sectioned face(s), including:  identifying material by selecting appropriate hatch pattern omaterial symbol; selecting appropriate face(s) for hatch; selecting appropriate angle and scale; creating legend for visual information, if necessary; and,determining which face(s) should not be hatched.

0AE5CC9BE208470B9B33F663ADA21267.description: Identify corresponding orthographic view with cutting plane.

491600E8276348CE92764EFC1FF85551.description: Identify and produce appropriate section views to best represent the shape of the object, including:  full section; half section; offset section; and, detailed design sections

28C7234CB2B547C09327EBF563276C9C.description: Design and describe shapes in a multi-view (orthographic) drawing.

1CB8DF84BD0247E7B08BDA10FF8137F7.description: Analyze the suitability of various section views (e.g., full section, half section, offset section).

394612F46F9E44B5A88AB77397D65685.description: Create appropriate section views of various objects.

BA8A9B446D5C449EB928FA99CC3D4738.description: Identify corresponding orthographic view with cutting plane on drawings

D5ED718A7D414E5F8E814BC05857EF66.description: Produce appropriately scaled full section views of objects: Select appropriate face(s) for hatch. Determine which face(s) should not be hatched.

A2429D5F535E41CEAB4A57F16ECE91CE.description: Discuss the purpose, characteristics and types of section views.

B6E910189969493D916C792F9DD2D2FB.description: Create full section views of various objects.

DF68EBFCA7984A6D845B5B9AF79F059A.description: Communicate verbally or in writing, purpose and proper use of orthographic drawings including specific language and terms.

928B41D51F1442E5A00255538D76A379.description: Lay out a drawing with two or three views using appropriate scale and placement of views.

82650AB0B84D49BE8B1B77A4BA2BBA89.description: Demonstrate understanding of the following: • all relevant measurements and information in technical drawings; shapes in multi-view drawings; and, abbreviations and their use.

78F4AAB8FF3D405681A1F4A586D03998.description: Place and select dimensions with consideration to production purposes.

C24586C4F95E4665BA1BEB29D2027102.description: Design drawings that incorporate drawing symbols used in advanced dimensioning.

ED713584159C41BFB25385748FF801BD.description: Create drawings that incorporate conventions of advanced dimensioning, including: counterbore and countersunk holes; angles and chamfers; specifying allowable manufacturer tolerances; non-circular curves; • assembly drawings; using appropriate abbreviating terms; and, placing notes with and without leaders.

6028A6EB17F740918C3FCAA30AA74BDA.description: Create drawings using principles of advanced dimensioning suitable for production purposes.

6F1CF448C40F4A0FA8097B64C3407014.description: Maintain an electronic portfolio of completed drawings.

0DC28D78B722403DBCE7F6622A36FB87.description: Recognize technical terms associated with 3D models.

3FDBDE9FD6C14CA091E69D90BAE25625.description: Produce a video presentation (e.g., virtual reality, animated, animated exploded assembly) of the components and/or finished project

26C84EF5E82E4677BEB326E407A914A8.description: Incorporate lighting to create desired shade and shadow effects in the 3D CAD environment.

1A50C6BFD6834C6D9063E6542B5F7513.description: Apply materials (e.g., faces, edges, colours) to the project in the 3D CAD environment.

8B8B39585AF647CBB08CC6CF9ACDB1BF.description: Identify tolerances and accurately displaying in presentation files.

49577F22FF64412E9BE61FDAFAFD7251.description: Produce multiple presentation files accurately displaying multiple components.

A67C005E825A4815B223E517F1869466.description: Create drawings of objects in 3D environment (e.g., multiple component objects).

571F85B354F34D7891FF117CF532269C.description: Produce project models in a 3D CAD environment
